availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin P. Wallace (Webster County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Elizabeth Wallace. Father of Robert T. Wallace, John D. Wallace, Samuel R. Wallace, William Wallace, and Mary E. Wallace. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 561.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 483A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 5, p. 249A.
"Benjamin P. Wallace (1824-1870)," Find A Grave, Memorial #36374937, accessed Feburary 4, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36374937.
